message.content:
Below is a worked‐through solution showing how to recreate the “car”‐like structure exactly as shown.

────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
1)  DETAILED DESCRIPTION OF THE TARGET IMAGE
────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
• Block Count and Layers  
  – Total of 6 blocks.  
  – There are four “layers” from bottom to top:  
    Layer 1 (bottom): Two orange cylinders serving as wheels.  
    Layer 2 (middle): One yellow rectangular block bridging across the two wheels.  
    Layer 3: Two blue cubes stacked vertically to form the “cab.”  
    Layer 4 (top): One orange triangular/roof block sitting atop the blue cubes.

• Spatial Relationships  
  – The two orange cylinders (Layer 1) lie parallel to each other, supporting the structure above.  
  – The yellow rectangular block (Layer 2) rests on and spans across both cylinders.  
  – The pair of blue cubes (Layer 3) sits on the rear portion of the yellow block, stacked one on top of the other.  
  – The orange roof wedge (Layer 4) is centered on the uppermost blue cube.

────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
2)  SELECTING BLOCKS FROM THE DICTIONARY
────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
To match color, shape, and **exact** orientation (no further rotation allowed), use:

• Two copies of block #1 (Blue Cube) — for the stacked “cab.”  
• One copy of block #6 (Yellow Rectangular Block) — oriented front‐to‐back for the “body.”  
• Two copies of block #9 (Orange Cylinder) — horizontally oriented “wheels.”  
• One copy of block #15 (Orange Triangular/Roof) — sloped front‐to‐back.

Hence the required block indices are: 1, 1, 6, 9, 9, 15.

────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
3)  STEP‐BY‐STEP ASSEMBLY INSTRUCTIONS
────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
{
  Step1: Move block with index 9   // First orange cylinder (front wheel)
  Step2: Move block with index 9   // Second orange cylinder (rear wheel)
  Step3: Move block with index 6   // Yellow rectangular block bridging the two wheels
  Step4: Move block with index 1   // Bottom blue cube on the rear part of the yellow block
  Step5: Move block with index 1   // Second blue cube stacked on the first
  Step6: Move block with index 15  // Orange roof wedge on top of the blue cubes
}

Use the above sequence to recreate the target image exactly as shown.
